cards.flavorText: Cut and bruised from his climb to the summit, Zahr wept with relief when he saw the felidar's horns appear.
cards.name: Felidar Savior
cards.text:
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
When this creature enters, put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two other target creatures you control.

cards.flavorText:
"Ah, the conquering hero returns! What trials did you face, little one?"
—Basri Ket
cards.name: Helpful Hunter
cards.text: When this creature enters, draw a card.

cards.flavorText: One day, the future king will protect a pride of his own. For now, he defends his family from the terror of the swishy tail.
cards.name: Prideful Parent
cards.text:
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
When this creature enters, create a 1/1 white Cat creature token.

cards.flavorText: Her master gathered the bones to resurrect her, only to find her purring on the altar.
cards.name: Nine-Lives Familiar
cards.text:
This creature enters with eight revival counters on it if you cast it.
When this creature dies, if it had a revival counter on it, return it to the battlefield with one fewer revival counter on it at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavorText: "You thought I was unarmed? Poor fool—your veins are my arsenal."
cards.name: Vengeful Bloodwitch
cards.text: Whenever this creature or another creature you control dies, target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.flavorText: Setessa is protected by four warrior factions, each named for an animal. United, they can repel any threat to their polis.
cards.name: Anthem of Champions
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: Ajani, Caller of the Pride

rulings.text: The number of Cat tokens you put onto the battlefield is equal to your life total when the third ability resolves.
You can activate the first ability without a target. You’ll still put one loyalty counter on Ajani when you activate the ability.

cards.text:
[+1]: Put a +1/+1 counter on up to one target creature.
[−3]: Target creature gains flying and double strike until end of turn.
[−8]: Create X 2/2 white Cat creature tokens, where X is your life total.

cards.flavorText: Clerics on both sides prayed for divine intervention to end the war. The gods didn't play favorites.
cards.name: Day of Judgment
cards.text: Destroy all creatures.

cards.flavorText:
"One alone is fearsome; one among many is unstoppable."
—Benalish proverb
cards.name: Savannah Lions

cards.flavorText:
"The things I once imagined would be my greatest achievements were only the first steps toward a future I can only begin to fathom."
—Jace Beleren
cards.name: Omniscience

rulings.text: If a spell has {X} in its mana cost, you must choose 0 as the value of X when casting it without paying its mana cost.

If you cast a spell "without paying its mana cost," you can't choose to cast it for any alternative costs. You can, however, pay additional costs, such as kicker costs. If the card has any mandatory additional costs, such as that of Tormenting Voice, those must be paid to cast the spell.

Once you cast Omniscience, if it's your turn, you'll have priority immediately after it resolves. You can cast another spell before any player can attempt to remove Omniscience with spells or abilities.
You must follow the normal timing permissions and restrictions of each spell you cast.

cards.text: You may cast spells from your hand without paying their mana costs.

cards.flavorText: Odric resisted the vampire's curse with all his strength. But after a lifetime of fighting monsters, he was doomed to become one himself.
cards.name: Hero's Downfall
cards.text: Destroy target creature or planeswalker.

cards.name: Liliana, Dreadhorde General

rulings.text: As Liliana's last ability resolves, the next opponent in turn order (or, if it's somehow an opponent's turn, that opponent) makes all of their choices for it, then each other opponent in turn order does the same, knowing the choices made before them. Then all the unchosen permanents are sacrificed at the same time.

As Liliana's second loyalty ability resolves, first the player whose turn it is chooses two creatures they control, then each other player in turn order does the same, knowing the choices made before them. Then all the chosen creatures are sacrificed at the same time. If any player can choose only one creature, that player does so.
If Liliana dies at the same time as one or more creatures you control, her first ability triggers for each of those creatures.
If Liliana somehow becomes a creature and dies, her first ability will trigger.
The permanent types are artifact, creature, enchantment, land, and planeswalker. Supertypes, like legendary, aren't permanent types.

While making choices for Liliana's last ability, if a permanent has more than one permanent type, it can count for any of them. For example, you could choose an artifact creature as the artifact you're sparing, another creature as the creature, and an enchantment creature as the enchantment. Similarly, you could choose an enchantment creature as both the creature and the enchantment that you're sparing, even if you control another creature and/or another enchantment.

cards.text:
Whenever a creature you control dies, draw a card.
[+1]: Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
[−4]: Each player sacrifices two creatures.
[−9]: Each opponent chooses a permanent they control of each permanent type and sacrifices the rest.

cards.flavorText: Unlike Innistrad's more ostentatious vampire families, Stromkirk vampires take pride in silence and subterfuge.
cards.name: Stromkirk Bloodthief

rulings.text: Stromkirk Bloodthief's ability cares whether an opponent lost life this turn, not how their life total changed. For example, an opponent who gained 2 life and lost 1 life in the same turn still lost life.

cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, if an opponent lost life this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on target Vampire you control.

cards.flavorText: The elves of the Llanowar forest have defended it for generations. It is their sacred duty to keep outside influences from corrupting their ancestral home.
cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.

cards.name: Vivien Reid
cards.text:
[+1]: Look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal a creature or land card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
[−3]: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or creature with flying.
[−8]: You get an emblem with "Creatures you control get +2/+2 and have vigilance, trample, and indestructible."

cards.flavorText:
"Knowing everything reveals not answers, but in fact their profound absence."
—Gadwick, the Wizened

Once you cast Omniscience, if it's your turn, you'll have priority immediately after it resolves. You can cast another spell before any player can attempt to remove Omniscience with spells or abilities.
You must follow the normal timing permissions and restrictions of each spell you cast.

cards.flavorText: Setessa is protected by four warrior factions, each named for an animal. United, they can repel any threat to their polis.
cards.name: Anthem of Champions
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.flavorText: The Boros built a prison in the sky where Azorius statutes couldn't restrict their sense of justice.
cards.name: Angelic Edict
cards.text: Exile target creature or enchantment.

cards.flavorText: Elesh Norn screamed as the light pierced her. Her nightmare had become flesh.
cards.name: Elspeth's Smite

rulings.text: Creatures don't necessarily have to be dealt lethal damage by Elspeth's Smite to be exiled. After being dealt damage, if they would die for any reason that turn, they'll be exiled instead.

cards.text: Elspeth's Smite deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature. If that creature would die this turn, exile it instead.

cards.flavorText: Leonin claws were already deadly weapons of natural evolution before he improved upon them.
cards.name: Ingenious Leonin
cards.text: {3}{W}: Put a +1/+1 counter on another target attacking creature you control. If that creature is a Cat, it gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Jazal Goldmane
cards.text:
First strike
{3}{W}{W}: Attacking creatures you control get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of attacking creatures.

cards.flavorText: The skyhunters were born when the first leonin gazed at the heavens and wished to hunt the birds overhead.
cards.name: Leonin Skyhunter
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavorText: The best fighters are skilled in both harming and healing.
cards.name: Leonin Vanguard

rulings.text: If you don’t control three or more creatures as Leonin Vanguard’s ability resolves, the ability does nothing. However, if you do control three or more creatures as it resolves, the +1/+1 bonus doesn’t stop applying if you no longer control three creatures later in the turn.

If you don’t control three or more creatures as your combat phase begins, Leonin Vanguard’s ability won’t trigger at all. Causing a permanent to become a creature during the beginning of combat step won’t cause Leonin Vanguard’s ability to trigger.

cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you control three or more creatures, Leonin Vanguard gets +1/+1 until end of turn and you gain 1 life.

cards.flavorText: "The time of salvation is at hand. Dusk washes over the world, and the Legion will rise immortal!"
cards.name: Moment of Triumph

rulings.text: If the target creature is an illegal target by the time Moment of Triumph tries to resolve, the spell doesn’t resolve. You won’t gain 2 life.

cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. You gain 2 life.

cards.flavorText:
"If only they'd all act this docile. I could do something relaxing for a living. I've always wanted to bake biscuits."
—Ethuk, Coppercoat mage
cards.name: Pacifism
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.

cards.flavorText: For the more refined vampire, breaking a victim's will is far more satisfying than simply taking their blood.
cards.name: Bloodtithe Collector

rulings.text: Bloodtithe Collector's triggered ability cares whether an opponent lost life this turn, not how their life total changed. For example, an opponent who gained 2 life and lost 1 life in the same turn still lost life.

cards.text:
Flying
When Bloodtithe Collector enters, if an opponent lost life this turn, each opponent discards a card.

cards.name: Crossway Troublemakers

rulings.text: You may pay 2 life only once for each Vampire that dies. You can't pay multiple times for the same triggered ability and draw multiple cards.

cards.text:
Attacking Vampires you control have deathtouch and lifelink.
Whenever a Vampire you control dies, you may pay 2 life. If you do, draw a card.

cards.flavorText: With the bloodchiefs annihilated in the fight between the free and enthralled, the swamps around Malakir are full of dangerous, young vampires eager to make their marks.
cards.name: Highborn Vampire

cards.flavorText: "The time of condemnation is at hand. Dusk washes over the world, and I consign you to eternal darkness!"
cards.name: Moment of Craving

rulings.text: If the target creature is an illegal target by the time Moment of Craving tries to resolve, the spell doesn’t resolve. You won’t gain 2 life.

The target creature will still be on the battlefield when you gain life, even if its toughness has been reduced to 0 or less. Any abilities it has that interact with gaining life do so as appropriate. If any abilities trigger on you gaining life, the creature will be put into its owner’s graveyard after that ability triggers but before it resolves.

cards.text: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn. You gain 2 life.

cards.flavorText: "Give all you are to Phyrexia, and you will receive more than you could have ever desired."
cards.name: Offer Immortality
cards.text: Target creature gains deathtouch and indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)

cards.flavorText:
"Mindlessness is not weakness. When we are lost to hunger we are unstoppable."
—Drana, Kalastria bloodchief
cards.name: Untamed Hunger
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1 and has menace. (It can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

cards.flavorText: He hovers silently above the city, scouting for when the ripest necks pass through the darkest alleys.
cards.name: Vampire Interloper
cards.text:
Flying
Vampire Interloper can't block.

cards.flavorText: One day, they may be paragons of deadly elegance. For the moment, they possess nothing but thirst.
cards.name: Vampire Neonate

rulings.text: In a Two-Headed Giant game, Vampire Neonate’s ability causes the opposing team to lose 2 life and you to gain 1 life.

cards.text: {2}, {T}: Each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.flavorText: Unsuccessful vampire hunters often wind up as ravenous spawn.
cards.name: Vampire Spawn
cards.text: When Vampire Spawn enters, each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

cards.flavorText:
"There are lands beyond Valley. Wild, calamity-scarred, and beautiful."
—Farfeather, birdfolk scout
cards.name: Uncharted Haven

rulings.text: If Uncharted Haven is somehow on the battlefield without a chosen color, its mana ability won't make any mana.

cards.text:
Uncharted Haven enters tapped. As it enters, choose a color.
{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color.
